thread.title: U.S. carrier group patrols in South China Sea - U.S. navy
thread.title_full: U.S. carrier group patrols in South China Sea - U.S. navy

title: U.S. carrier group patrols in South China Sea - U.S. navy
text:
World News | Sun Feb 19, 2017 | 1:24am GMT U.S. carrier group patrols in South China Sea - U.S. navy FILE PHOTO - Sailors man the rails of the USS Carl Vinson, a Nimitz-class aircraft carrier, as it departs its home port in San Diego, California August 22, 2014. REUTERS/Mike Blake 
BANGKOK A United States aircraft carrier strike group has begun patrols in the South China Sea, the U.S. navy said on Saturday, amid renewed tension over the disputed waterway. 
China's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday warned Washington against challenging its sovereignty, responding to reports the United States was planning fresh naval patrols in the South China Sea. 
The navy said the force, including Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Carl Vinson, began routine operations in the South China Sea on Saturday. The announcement was posted on the Vinson's Facebook page. 
(Reporting by Michael Perry)
